name: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions
Cut pancetta into small cubes and cook in a large skillet until crispy
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, and black pepper
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed
Serve immediately with additional cheese and black pepper

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and half the spices for 2 hours
Heat ghee in a large pan and cook marinated chicken until done
In the same pan, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant
Add remaining spices and cook for 1 minute
Add tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes
Stir in cream and cooked chicken
Simmer for 5 more minutes and garnish with cilantro

name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F and line baking sheets with parchment
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
Cream butter and both sugars until fluffy
Beat in eggs and vanilla
Gradually mix in flour mixture
Stir in chocolate chips
Drop rounded tablespoons on baking sheets
Bake 9-11 minutes until golden brown

name: Beef and Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: Marinate beef with soy sauce and cornstarch for 15 minutes
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat
Stir-fry beef until browned, then remove
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds
Return beef to pan with stir-fry sauce
Toss everything together and serve with rice

name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F with pizza stone if available
Roll out pizza dough on floured surface
Transfer to cornmeal-dusted pizza pan
Spread tomato sauce evenly, leaving border for crust
Add mozzarella slices and sprinkle Parmesan
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper
Bake 10-12 minutes until crust is golden
Top with fresh basil before serving

name: Classic Caesar Salad
instructions: Wash and chop romaine lettuce, then chill
Make croutons by toasting cubed bread with garlic and oil
For dressing: mash garlic and anchovies into a paste
Whisk in egg yolk, lemon juice, and mustard
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking
Toss lettuce with dressing
Top with Parmesan, croutons, and black pepper

name: Teriyaki Glazed Salmon
instructions: Pat salmon fillets dry and season with salt
Mix soy sauce, honey, vinegar, and cornstarch for glaze
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook salmon skin-side up for 4-5 minutes
Flip and cook 3-4 minutes more
Add garlic and ginger to pan, cook 30 seconds
Pour glaze over salmon and cook until thickened
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions

name: Mixed Vegetable Curry
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat
Sauté onion until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add garlic, ginger, and curry powder, cook 1 minute
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer
Add potatoes and cook 10 minutes
Add green beans and bell pepper, cook 8 minutes
Stir in spinach until wilted
Season with salt and garnish with cilantro

name: Moist Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease a loaf pan
Mash bananas in a large mixing bowl
Mix in melted butter with mashed bananas
Add sugar, egg, and vanilla, mix well
Sprinkle baking soda and salt over mixture
Add flour and mix until just combined
Fold in walnuts if using
Pour into loaf pan and bake 60-65 minutes

name: Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F
Set up breading station: flour, eggs, breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan
Season chicken with salt and pepper
Dredge chicken in flour, then egg, then breadcrumb mixture
Heat oil in large oven-safe skillet
Cook chicken 3-4 minutes per side until golden
Top with marinara sauce and mozzarella
Bake 15-20 minutes until cheese melts and chicken reaches 165°F

name: Traditional Greek Salad
instructions: Cut all vegetables into bite-sized pieces
Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper in large bowl
Add olives and feta cheese
Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper
Pour dressing over salad
Toss gently to combine
Let sit 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld

name: Ground Beef Tacos
instructions: Brown ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat
Drain excess fat
Add taco seasoning and water, simmer 5 minutes
Warm taco shells according to package directions
Prepare all toppings in separate bowls
Fill each taco shell with seasoned beef
Top with desired toppings
Serve with lime wedges and salsa

name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Heat broth in a separate pot and keep warm
Sauté mushrooms in olive oil until golden, set aside
In same pan, cook onion until translucent
Add garlic and rice, stir for 2 minutes
Add wine and stir until absorbed
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly
Continue until rice is creamy and tender, about 20 minutes
Stir in mushrooms, butter, and Parmesan

name: Classic Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F
Line pie pan with bottom crust
Mix sliced apples with sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt
Fill crust with apple mixture and dot with butter
Cover with top crust and crimp edges
Cut vents in top crust
Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar
Bake 45-50 minutes until golden brown

name: Traditional Pad Thai
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft
Mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar for sauce
Heat oil in wok over high heat
Scramble eggs and remove from pan
Cook shrimp and garlic until shrimp is pink
Add drained noodles and sauce, toss to coat
Add bean sprouts and green onions
Return eggs to pan and toss everything together
Serve with peanuts and lime wedges

name: Italian Meatball Subs
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F
Mix ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, Parmesan, garlic, salt, and pepper
Form into 16 meatballs
Heat oil in large skillet and brown meatballs on all sides
Add marinara sauce and simmer 15 minutes
Split sub rolls and toast lightly
Fill rolls with meatballs and sauce
Top with mozzarella cheese
Bake 5-7 minutes until cheese melts

name: Homemade Chicken Soup
instructions: Place chicken in large pot with water, bay leaves, and thyme
Bring to boil, then simmer 1 hour until chicken is tender
Remove chicken and shred meat, discard bones
Strain broth and return to pot
Add carrots, celery, and onion to broth
Simmer 15 minutes until vegetables are tender
Add egg noodles and cook according to package directions
Return shredded chicken to pot and season with salt and pepper

name: Baja Fish Tacos
instructions: Season fish with salt, pepper, chili powder, and cumin
Dredge fish in flour
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat
Fry fish 3-4 minutes per side until golden
Warm tortillas on griddle
Mix cabbage with lime juice and cilantro
Flake fish into pieces
Assemble tacos with fish, cabbage slaw, and avocado
Top with sour cream and serve with lime wedges

name: Fudgy Chocolate Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease 8x8 baking pan
Melt butter and dark chocolate together, let cool slightly
Whisk in sugar until combined
Beat in eggs one at a time, then vanilla
Sift together cocoa powder, flour, and salt
Fold dry ingredients into chocolate mixture
Stir in chocolate chips
Pour into prepared pan and bake 25-30 minutes

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook in water until tender, about 15 minutes
Let quinoa cool completely
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper
Combine cooled quinoa with vegetables
Add herbs and feta cheese
Toss with dressing
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving
